byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia.

abstract: Human Rights Watch says many high-ranking officers in Colombia's armed forces may have known about soldiers killing civilians, presenting deaths instead as guerrilla casualties in battle against rebel insurgents.
lead_paragraph: Human Rights Watch says Colombian prosecutors face numerous obstacles in trying to hold high-level officials in the armed forces accountable for killings, in which civilians are presented as armed insurgents.

headline.main: Colombia Military Accused of Deception on Civilian Deaths
headline.print_headline: Colombia Military Accused of Deception on Deaths

snippet: Human Rights Watch says Colombian prosecutors face numerous obstacles in trying to hold high-level officials in the armed forces accountable for killings, in which civilians are presented as armed insurgents.
